Title: editor.experimentalEditContextEnabled option cannot be set
Description: I noticed that the underline effect of the composition string has reverted to the original, so this feature is likely not enabled by default after stabilization, contrary to what was stated in the 1.94 release notes. And it seems that this issue often occurs: when I start typing, the first letter is directly committed to the screen instead of becoming a composing character in the IME. This is a little bit annoying.
thinking: The email expresses two issues with a product or feature, indicating dissatisfaction. The tone is not extremely angry but shows annoyance, which aligns more with 'Negative' than 'Very Negative'. The emotion seems to be 'Anger' due to the frustration expressed with the functionality not meeting expectations.

Title: Indicate workspace or remote MCP Server
Description: Indicate workspace or remote MCP Server
thinking: The email body is very brief and seems to be a request or instruction to indicate a workspace or remote MCP server. There is no emotional tone or language that suggests a positive or negative sentiment. The tone is more neutral and instructional, with a sense of anticipation or expectation that the recipient will take some action.

thinking: The email body appears to be an error report, specifically a bug report, with a title that includes the word "Bug". The content includes technical details and system information, but the tone is neutral to negative. The phrase "一直反馈 很抱歉，未返回响应" translates to "Continuous feedback, sorry, no response returned", which implies a sense of frustration or disappointment. There is no apparent joy, trust, or positive sentiment in the message. The closest emotion-based sentiment is Anger, although Frustration would be a more accurate classification if it were available.
